2 Text: Self-inverting structure: split block, R' = L âŠ• F(R,key), L' = R. DES uses this.
Alternating S-boxes (substitution) and P-boxes (permutation). AES uses this.

1 Text: What provides confusion in block ciphers?
2 Text: S-boxes. Each ciphertext bit depends on many key bits.

1 Text: What provides diffusion in block ciphers?
2 Text: Permutations. Each plaintext bit affects many ciphertext bits.

1 Text: Why is DES key schedule weak?
2 Text: Enables related-key attacks. Good key schedules resist this.
